caption: Ninety percent of this square is taken up by the huge pond like fountain, that is truly entertaining, with its quirky sculptures spouting water, fun for all the family to enjoy.
The fountains were very nice, but unfortunately the square itself is filthy.

The Fontaine Stravinsky square is situated just outside Centre Pompidou in the Le Marais district of Paris. Little to see/do here other than see the (Stravinsky Fountain) - a an intriguing fountain with 16 whimsical sculptures inspired by and to commemorate the late composer Igor Stravinsky.  The fountain is turned off during the winter months and the pool emptied. However, the various sculptures are always interesting to see, even if just to imagine what the fountain looks like during warmer months of the year. It's fine to give the fountain a few minutes to view and enjoy before/after your visit to the Centre Pompidou.  There is a large scale street art image of a man shushing the crowd just behind the fountain. That is worth a quick look-see if you are into street and graffiti art.
For Stravinsky fans, this is a must. For anyone else, this is a must! Totally cool area with a fountain of sculptures, and next to Pompidou. Loved it!
I personally really like this square. If you hang out in Ch√¢telet is very near and it worth to go to visit

Nice little square, full of life, street buskers and performers of all sorts.
Beautiful square with a lot of artists, so pity for the works at the fountain

The Place Igor Stravinsky is one of the most delightful squares in Paris. I loved the colourful fun sculptures in the pond by Jean Tinguely and Niki de Saint Phalle, as well as the ambiance of the surrounding cafes with outdoor seating. It's easy to combine with a visit to the Centre Pompidou. Children will love it.
Nice graffiti if you happen to be in the neighborhood.

Igor Stravinsky Square, located in the heart of Paris next to the Center Pompidou, is a truly unique and lively space, perfect for a cultural and artistic break. The square is famous for its colorful and extravagant fountain, the Fontaine Stravinsky, a work by Jean Tinguely and Niki de Saint Phalle that pays homage to the Russian composer with playful shapes and moving mechanisms. The bizarre sculptures and bright colors give a modern and dynamic touch, perfect for those who love street art and contemporary art.  Next to the square, stands the Church of Saint-Merri, a Gothic jewel often overlooked by tourists but absolutely worth seeing. The church, with its detailed facade and stained glass windows, creates a charming contrast to the modern style of Pompidou and the fountain. Inside there is an atmosphere of peace and history, and it is one of the few places in the center where you can find a bit of tranquility.  An experience that I recommend to all those who love discovering the most creative and unexpected side of Paris.

Iconic. Interactive journey via QR code, each work has its own story, its own music.  The last time I was in Paris it was under maintenance and I finally managed to see it. The square is next to the Center George Pomipidou, very easy to find
It's nice to sit quietly and have a drink when the sun isn't shining. It's been a while since I've been here, but it looks like it's been cleaned up a bit because it's the Olympics.

A stone's throw from the Pompidou Center, contemporary art which leaves its mark in the heart of Paris, that's what it's like. Magnificent place, quite a lot of people but nevertheless calm and cool in summer.
Beautiful and free, we really liked it!

Measuring 81 by 35 metres, it assumed this name in 1979 and was adorned with a fountain also named after the Russian composer. Below the square, there are five floors of the musical acoustics research institute, which is also located to the side. Other works of urban art decorate the spaces. The¬†Georges-Pompidou National Center of Art and Culture, the¬†Gothic church of Saint-Merri and some cafes overlook the square.

Since 1983, this square has had the Igor Stravinsky fountain. This fountain consists of a large pool where you can find 16 sculptures in metal and resin, created by artists Niki de Saint Phalle and Jean Tinguely, inspired by the "Rite of Spring" by the composer, conductor and pianist Igor Stravinsky and each sculpture has a name. The mechanization and animation of the sculptures is done using water jets, and it is 100% reused as the fountain works in a closed circuit.

Located right next to Beaubourg, this atypical square has a magical side to see with or without children...the large pool and its animated sculptures, the Street Art on the surrounding walls, the old Church without forgetting the terraced esplanade bistros

A square with a lot of charm and atmosphere, due to the mobile contraptions of the fountain and the terraces full of people. Very good vibes and cheap prices (50 cl. beer at 5 euros). On one side there are several tents belonging to homeless people.
A pretty, colorful place with soft tinkling sounds. I really liked the frescoes on the walls!

Square full of contrasts, with the Church of Saint-Merri, Stravinsky's modern art fountain and the large streetart mural by Jef A√©rosol. They combine in harmony in this square attached to the Pompidou museum.
